title: NJ Governor Requests Expertise Who Still Know COBOL

replies.msg:
That’s so fucking hilarious lol:

https://nymag.com/intelligencer/2020/04/what-is-cobol-what-does-it-have-to-do-with-the-coronavirus.html

Over the weekend, New Jersey governor Phil Murphy put out an open call for tech experts to help balance the load placed on the state’s unemployment system, which runs on a legacy programming language called COBOL.

quote.msg:
That’s so fucking hilarious lol:

https://nymag.com/intelligencer/2020/04/what-is-cobol-what-does-it-have-to-do-with-the-coronavirus.html

Over the weekend, New Jersey governor Phil Murphy put out an open call for tech experts to help balance the load placed on the state’s unemployment system, which runs on a legacy programming language called COBOL.

replies.msg: “We have systems that are 40-plus years old,” the governor said at a press conference. “There’ll be lots of postmortems, and one of them will be how the heck did we get here?, when we literally needed COBOL programmers.” As an unintentional testament to the language’s highly niche status, Murphy pronounced it as “cobalt” (it’s unclear if this was an error or a speech quirk).
Who said it’s just a piece of cake to find a COBAL  programmer in India? Lol
No wonder there are still a wide applications of i386 and mainframe pcs. Boomer programmer writes more vulnerable code

quote.msg: No wonder there are still a wide applications of i386 and mainframe pcs. Boomer programmer writes more vulnerable code
